dt: {bc}placing a {d_link|moderate|moderate:1} estimate on one's abilities or worth
{bc}arising from or characteristic of a modest nature

pt: {sc}shy{/sc} {sc}bashful{/sc} {sc}diffident{/sc} {sc}modest{/sc} {sc}coy{/sc} mean not inclined to be forward. {sc}shy{/sc} implies a timid reserve and a shrinking from familiarity or contact with others.
{sc}bashful{/sc} implies a frightened or hesitant shyness characteristic of childhood and adolescence.

pt.t: a {it}bashful{/it} boy out on his first date

pt: {sc}diffident{/sc} stresses a distrust of one's own ability or opinion that causes hesitation in acting or speaking.
{sc}modest{/sc} suggests absence of undue confidence or conceit.

{sc}chaste{/sc} {sc}pure{/sc} {sc}modest{/sc} {sc}decent{/sc} mean free from all taint of what is lewd or salacious. {sc}chaste{/sc} primarily implies a refraining from acts or even thoughts or desires that are not virginal or not sanctioned by marriage vows.
{sc}pure{/sc} differs from {sc}chaste{/sc} in implying innocence and absence of temptation rather than control of one's impulses and actions.
{sc}modest{/sc} and {sc}decent{/sc} apply especially to deportment and dress as outward signs of inward chastity or purity.

pt.t: {it}decent{/it} people didn't go to such movies

quotes.t: … these remnants he lacked the will to discard, depressed him, deepening the low fever of depression in which even as {qword}modest{/qword} a task as removing a blue doorknob loomed like a mountain almost impossible to climb.

The foundry work was grueling, but for a little longer Brierfield afforded these African Americans a way station of {qword}modest{/qword} freedom and a residue of authentic independence that was fast disappearing for most rural blacks.

You're the hero, so then you have to behave in a certain way—there is a prescription for it. You have to be {qword}modest{/qword}, you have to be forbearing, you have to be deferential, you have to be understanding.

et: Latin {it}modestus{/it} moderate; akin to Latin {it}modus{/it} measure
shortdef: placing a moderate estimate on one's abilities or worth
neither bold nor self-assertive : tending toward diffidence
arising from or characteristic of a modest nature
